Package net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao

Data access support classes.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DAOHelper.AfterTransactionCallback
    Called after a Transaction completed.
    DAOHelper.BeforeTransactionCallback
    Called before a transaction is started.
    DAOHelper.ResultTransactionCallback<R>
    Transaction callback with a return value.
    DAOHelper.TransactionCallback
    Transaction callback.
    DAOHelper.VoidTransactionCallback
    Transaction callback with a void return type.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DAOHelper
    Helper implementation for CRUD based DAOs.
    DAOHelper.ResultTransactionCallbackImpl<R>
    Helper implementation for use with the transaction callback interfaces.
    DAOHelper.VoidTransactionCallbackImpl
    Helper implementation for use with the transaction callback interfaces.
    EntityRetriever
    A singleton access point for retrieving attached entities.
    EntityRetrieverImpl
    An implementation of EntityRetriever that is intended to be configured through Spring.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DAOHelper.DAOEntityStateValidationException
    Exception generated when DAO validation for checking the contracted entity states is violated.

Package net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao Description

Data access support classes.

EntityRetriever provides the ability to reattach Hibernate entities. It also provides a method to narrow a proxy if necessary.

DAOHelper is an abstract class that is intended to be extended by DAO implementations. It has several helpful doInTransaction methods that can be passed lambdas since the parameters are functional interfaces. Example:


 public Entity saveEntity(Entity object)
 {
   return
   doInTransaction(session -> {
    if(isAttached(object) || isTransient(object))
    {
      session.saveOrUpdate(object);
      return object;
    }
    else
    {
      Entity merged = (Entity) session.merge(object);
      return (Entity) session.get(Entity.class, merged.getId());
    }
  });
 }
Additionally, there are quite a few other helper methods defined in DAOHelper.
